text:
Cultures all over the world
have been using frame drums

and when we dance
to a rhythmic drum beat,

it allows us to drop
into altered states,
allowing our soul to travel.
It's magic.

We have a privilege
to dump a ton of hucha.
Hucha means heavy energy.

In the West, we call it
"emotional baggage,"
or your "stuff."

We're gonna give you
a blindfold

and I'm gonna take you through
a guided meditation.
In my ancestry,

with the mongolian medicine
men and women, the shamans

they hold the drum like this
and they bang it so fast

that they drum themselves out
of their body,

the soul leaves, and in comes
the soul of the guiding spirit
that they work with.
[quirky musical flourish]

- I'm not scared.
I'm a little anxious

about connecting
to the spirit world

because I don't really know
a lot of my extended family,

so it was a little weird
for me
to channel those people,

but I'm curious
to see whatever shows up.
[chuckles]

- We're not really very
connected with our ancestors,
and it's sad,

but to understand
how they may have affected us,

you know, it's really key
to our souls' development.

- I never had a good
relationship with my family,

so ancestors better
[bleep] come at me

with positive
energy,

because if you're bringing
your [bleep] to me,

I'm sending it back at you,
bitch.

- What you're doing is using
your body as an instrument

to move that
which you are carrying

that you no longer
are served by.

So you ain't passing [bleep] on
no mo'.
- Breaking the cycle of trauma.

- Hey, I'll break our [bleep]
away, Mom, don't worry.
[laughter]

- What?
- I'll dance our [bleep].

I got you.
[laughter]
- That's what I'm saying.

- Hey, we got lots of--
we got lots of hucha.
[laughter]

- So just stand up where
you can and find some space.

- Lord, have mercy.
I don't know about this.
- Going into the ceremony,

I'm feeling nervous
and concerned

with how it's going
to be facilitated,
how it's gonna be guided,

'cause we're just throwing
them in the deep end right now
and I'm like, "Whoa, okay."
